abstract: Robin Domeniconi has been named the new chief brand officer for Elle magazine, overseeing its content, advertising and marketing.
snippet: Robin Domeniconi has been named the new chief brand officer for Elle magazine, overseeing its content, advertising and marketing.
lead_paragraph: Robin Domeniconi has been named the new chief brand officer for Elle magazine, overseeing its content, advertising and marketing. Ms. Domeniconi most recently worked as a vice president at Microsoft, where she was in charge of sales and marketing for media properties. But she has a history in the magazine world, too, having run sales and marketing at Time Inc. and working as publisher and president of Real Simple. Carol Smith left the position at Elle in April to work at Condé Nast, overseeing the company’s new epicurean group. Ms. Domeniconi starts full time in July, according to Hachette Filipacchi Media U.S., Elle’s publisher.

headline.main: Brand Officer Named at Elle Magazine
headline.print_headline: Brand Officer Named at Elle Magazine
